Rewari is well connected by road and railway. Rewari was the first town in North India west of Delhi to be connected to a railway line. Delhi-Rewari metre gauge line was the first railway line in North India west of Delhi. Now the gauge of the track is broad gauge. You can board a train to Rewari from Delhi, Delhi Sarai Rohilla or Delhi Cantonment stations in Delhi. It takes a little less than two hours to travel the distance of 82 km from Delhi junction to Rewari junction. 
For travel to Rewari by road, take NH8 (Delhi-Jaipur national highway) from Delhi (Dhaula Kuan or Rao Tula Rao Marg crossing) and turn right at the Sahibi river bridge just after Dharuhera.
The nearest airport is Delhi airport, about 60 km away on NH8. The domestic terminal of the airport is connected to Bombay by about 20 flights every day and to other cities in India. The international terminal of the airport is connected to almost all Asian countries, Middle East, major European countries, USA and Canada and some countries in Africa and Latin America.

There is a public transport available in Rewari. One can move around the city in Auto Rickshaw and cycle rickshaw. The fare is cheap. However, you may negotiate well with the rickshaw puller before embarking if you are a foreigner.
Haryana roadways have started their city service to serve the people with just a fare of rs.5 only. You can roam around the city with this minimal fare.

The haveli of Rao Tula Ram and solarahi talaab and bada talaab has an historical importance. Basically the Bara Talab was 
made by Then Raja Rao Tej Singh. Solah Rahi is very beautiful historical place. A shiv Temple name Bhuteshwar Mandir Campus is very arrange and eye catching Place. All Hindi god-Goddess status are situated in the Mandir Campus. One Another Place Bhagwat Bhakti Ashram is also situated in Rewari. Very Respected Sant Swami Parmanand Ji Status is also establish there.

One Another Holy Place named Bhagwan Parsuram Mandir at Brahamgarh, Rewari. The Only temple in Rewari District of Sixth Avtaar of Bhagwan Vishnu name Bhagwan Parsuram.
